intro: Leandra ionopogon, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a velvety texture. Its leaves are typically broad and palmate, contributing to its ornamental appeal. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its propagation in natural habitats.
